posts.name: Kegan Cherry
posts.cooked:
Hello, I’d like to showcase and receive and feedback about our team’s new website . This is my first time making a full website and I want to make sure that the website’s design is good. The code can be found here . It is being hosted on Github Pages for free, with a custom domain from NameCheap.

The website was programmed with Dyad , an ai tool for building apps and website and has made the development and deployment of this very easy. As a student with limited time this was very benefitial for me.

Feel free to share your team’s website aswell!

link_counts.title: GitHub - tomball-robotics/tomball-robotics.github.io: Official Website for Tomball, T3 Robotics.
Dyad | Free, local, open-source AI app builder

posts.name: Kegan Cherry
posts.cooked:
The website also contains an admin panel that allows people, who dont have to know how to programming, to edit the site for years to come.

posts.name: Dominick Ferone
posts.cooked:
I love the simplicity of it. Interestingly enough, when I went to CTRL + Click a menu link I got met with a 404. image 981×656 32.2 KB

image 981×656 32.2 KB

image 981×656 32.2 KB

Seems to happen with each page other than the home. My guess would be how it interfaces with loading the page, not loading a new instance but possibly pulling up the page?

It also seems to have an issue with copying and pasting url, not loading if there is any paths included.

posts.name: Kegan Cherry
posts.cooked:
Thats very interesting, I think it has something to do with the routing. The site used to use a hashrouter natively from react, but i changed it for a browserrouter for simplicity and cleaner URLs.

”BrowserRouter uses clean, human-readable URLs and the HTML5 history API, requiring server configuration to handle direct access to specific routes, making it better for SEO and larger applications. HashRouter uses a # (hash) in the URL, which doesn’t require server configuration and works easily on static hosting, but creates less SEO-friendly and less clean URLs.”

The website is a static site running on a react framework, so thats most likely the issue, but I appreciate the feedback!

kegancherry:

BrowserRouter uses clean, human-readable URLs and the HTML5 history API, requiring server configuration to handle direct access to specific routes, making it better for SEO and larger applications.

Your answer’s right here; BrowserRouter will only work with additional server configuration. To fix this, you’d need to edit the build step to copy _site/index.html to _site/404.html . Also, the old gh-pages branch publishing method is less good; you should instead publish from GitHub Actions directly. Regardless, to fix your errors, you should edit your predeploy script in package.json from

to

Also, while the site looks good, the way it loads every time you navigate to a page, especially the homepage, is likely to deter people from looking at it; many studies have shown that extra loading time drives away users, here’s just one .

link_counts.title: Loading… loading… The influence of download time on information search - PMC
Configuring a publishing source for your GitHub Pages site - GitHub Docs

posts.cooked: Also, I’d highly recommend running any website you develop through Lighthouse , to find performance, accessibility, and SEO improvements. Here’s a report for your site; it shows that you definitely have room to improve in SEO and performance, especially on mobile.
